Package environment

Class Perception

  • java.lang.Object
    • environment.Perception
  • public class Perception
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for perceptions for agents. A Perception is a part of the World, perceived by an Agent. A Perception will be filled with Representations of the Items that Agent sees.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Perception​(int width, int height, int offsetX, int offsetY)
      Initializes a new Perception object

      static int distance​(CellPerception ap1, CellPerception ap2)
      Returns the distance between 2 CellPerceptions
      CellPerception getCellAt​(int x, int y)
      Returns the CellPerception that is positioned on the given coordinates in this Perception.
      CellPerception getCellPerceptionOnAbsPos​(int x, int y)
      Gets a CellPerception from this Perception using absolute coordinates (the coordinates of the environment/worlds).
      CellPerception getCellPerceptionOnRelPos​(int x, int y)
      Gets a CellPerception from this Perception using coordinates relative to the agent's position.

      Gets the horizontal offset of this Perception with respect to the coordinates of the environment/worlds.

      Gets the vertical offset of this Perception with respect to the coordinates of the environment/worlds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Perception

        public Perception​(int width,
                  int height,
                  int offsetX,
                  int offsetY)
        Initializes a new Perception object
        Parameters:
        width - width of the Perception
        height - height of the Perception
        offsetX - horizontal offset of the Perception
        offsetY - vertical offset of the Perception

    • Method Detail

      • getCellPerceptionOnAbsPos

        public CellPerception getCellPerceptionOnAbsPos​(int x,
                                                int y)
        Gets a CellPerception from this Perception using absolute coordinates (the coordinates of the environment/worlds).
        Returns:
        The cell perception if x and y fall within this Perception's bounds, null otherwise.

      • getCellPerceptionOnRelPos

        public CellPerception getCellPerceptionOnRelPos​(int x,
                                                int y)
        Gets a CellPerception from this Perception using coordinates relative to the agent's position. x and y may be negative.
        Returns:
        The cell perception if x and y fall within this Perception's relative bounds, null otherwise.

      • getNeighbours

        public CellPerception[] getNeighbours()
        Returns all Representations that are situated right next to the agent that issued this Perception.
        Returns:
        The Representations neighbouring the AgentRep of the agent that issued this Perception

      • getNeighboursInOrder

        public CellPerception[] getNeighboursInOrder()
        Returns all Representations that are situated right next to the agent that issued this Perception. The cells are in successive order in the returning array: 7 0 1 6 A 2 5 4 3
        Returns:
        The Representations neighbouring the AgentRep of the agent that issued this Perception

        Returns the distance between 2 coordinates
        Parameters:

        y1 - First position's Y
        x2 - Second position's X
        y2 - Second position's Y
        Returns:
        The distance between these coordinates

      • setSelfX

        public void setSelfX​(int x)
        Sets the x-coordinate of the owner of this perception
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the self in this perception (not in the world)

      • setSelfY

        public void setSelfY​(int y)
        Sets the y-coordinate of the owner of this perception
        Parameters:
        y - The y-coordinate of the self in this perception (not in the world)

        public void setCellPerceptionAt​(int x,
                                int y,
                                CellPerception cell)
        Sets a given Representation at the given coordinates in this perception
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate
        y - The Y coordinate
        cell - The Representation that is to be set here
